summary: This document is a letter from the United States Virgin Islands Department of Justice to Jeffrey Epstein outlining new travel notification requirements he must follow when traveling outside the territory. The letter specifies the conditions for notifying the department about his travel plans, emphasizing the need for in-person notification and detailed travel information.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Jeffrey Epstein is the recipient of the letter, which outlines new travel notification requirements he must comply with.

persons.name: Carol Thomas-Jacobs
persons.context: Carol Thomas-Jacobs is the sender of the letter, addressing Epstein and informing him of the new travel conditions.

locations: 6100 Red Hook, Suite 83, St. Thomas, VI 00802-1348
keyFacts: The letter outlines new travel notification requirements for Jeffrey Epstein when traveling outside the U.S. Virgin Islands.
Epstein must provide in-person notification at least 21 days prior to any intended travel.
Email notification is only acceptable if he is already outside the jurisdiction.
The requirements are pursuant to Chapter 86, Section 1724 (b) of the Virgin Islands Code and H.R.515 - International Megan's Law.
Previous provisions for travel notifications are no longer accepted by the USVIDOJ.
